instruction: How did the researchers utilize machine learning algorithms in conjunction with LIBS technology to estimate the contents of Fe and Cu in water samples from the Ebinur Lake Basin?
Output:
The researchers utilized machine learning algorithms in conjunction with LIBS technology to estimate the contents of Fe and Cu in water samples from the Ebinur Lake Basin by creatively using the Fe and Cu contents in water samples and the characteristics of their spectral curves in LIBS for regression modeling analysis. They developed a back-propagation (BP) network estimation model for Fe content and a BP estimation model for Cu content. 

For the Fe content estimation model, the relative percent deviation (RPD) was found to be 0.23, indicating poor prediction ability. Therefore, it was not possible to accurately predict the Fe content of samples using this model.

On the other hand, for the Cu content estimation model, the researchers achieved better results. The coefficient of determination (R-2) was 0.8, the root mean squared error (RMSE) was 0.1, and the RPD was 1.79. These values indicate good accuracy and strong predictive ability of the BP estimation model for Cu content. This model was able to accurately predict the Cu content in a sample.

Overall, the researchers demonstrated that estimation based on LIBS technology and machine learning algorithms improved the accuracy and efficiency of Fe and Cu content detection in water samples from the Ebinur Lake Basin.
